jobDescriptionCopy:
“Trulieve Grows One Patient at a Time”

If you have an interest in being part of one of the fastest growing industries in the nation in you may consider wanting to work for Trulieve! If you have a desire to help others in need through your efforts, this may be the role for you!

At Trulieve, we strive to bring our patients the relief they need in a product they can trust. Our plants are hand-grown in an environment specially designed to reduce unwanted chemicals and pests, keeping the process as natural as possible at every turn.

Our products are designed to alleviate seizures, severe and persistent muscle spasms, pain, nausea, loss of appetite, and other symptoms associated with serious medical conditions such as cancer.

Our specially trained staff works hand-in-hand with physicians to provide the right products and the correct dosage to ensure patients get the compassionate care they need.

Requisition ID: 1076

Remote Work Available: No

Job Title: Extraction Technician

Department: Manufacturing

Location: Hancock, MD

Shift: 1st, 2nd, 3rd

Role Summary:
Trulieve is looking for an Extraction Technician to support our extraction and production operations. You should be very technically astute in mechanical, electrical, and computer operated systems utilized in production/manufacturing environments. You need to be proactive, quick thinking and innovative in your approach.

Key Duties and Responsibilities:
Preparation of equipment and plant materials for extraction
Execution of extraction and processing in accordance with state and local standards
Operation of sophisticated extraction equipment
Ensure consistency and efficiency of product through quality control testing and procedures
Cleaning and maintenance of extraction equipment and manufacturing facility
Maintaining strict inventory records of all plant materials, chemicals, and equipment used in the facility
Oversee day-to-day operations of the entire extraction space beginning with storing the raw cannabis through the extraction process and all the way to fulfillment of orders
Operating, maintaining, and making adjustments and repairs to extraction equipment
Storing supplies and equipment and disposal of waste according to guidelines
Complete the cleaning and sanitization of all production equipment, work surfaces, and tools
Maintaining inventory records of supplies, materials, and equipment and preparing requisitions as needed
Maintaining material safety data sheets for all chemicals and products
Following all standard operating procedures regarding product creation and lab safety
Assist in packaging and labeling of finished products
Works with testing laboratory as defined by state guidelines
All other duties as assigned

Requirements

SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s or Associate degree or its equivalent, from a recognized college or university, with a major in chemistry or biology preferred
Understanding of state and local laws
Understanding of proper and safe handling of hazardous materials
Familiarity with separations, isolations and fractionation
Knowledge of solvent and non-solvent extraction methods
Stay current of practices and new developments in the cannabis extraction industry
Ability to work quickly without compromising accuracy
Ability to discern the quality of plant material and finished products
Strong computer and social skills

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
Must be able to push, pull, move, and/or lift a minimum of 25lbs to a minimum height of 5 feet and able to push, pull, move, and/or carry such weight a minimum distance of 50 feet, with or without mechanical assistance
Must be able to work seated/standing as appropriate at workstations for extended periods of time, maintain body equilibrium while climbing ladders, stairways, stopping, kneeling, crouching, and reaching, and use hands/fingers to hold, grasp, turn, pick, pinch frequently/constantly to complete tasks
Must be able to handle organic matter daily, able to wear PPE as appropriate (eye, face, hand, arm, head, foot, body, fall protection), and able to be exposed to hot, cold, wet, humid, or windy conditions while wearing PPE (95 degrees or greater)
Must have visual acuity with/without job aids to perform activities such as; reading, viewing a computer terminal, visual inspection involving small parts/details. Clarity of vision at 20 ft or more in day and night/dark conditions
Must be able to speak and communicate verbally at conversation levels with co-workers, vendors, etc. (Moderate noise)

WORK SCHEDULE:
40+ hours weekly with flexible hours depending on department needs. Must be available to work occasional evenings, weekends, and holidays

Equal Opportunity Employer l Trulieve Supports a Drug Free Workplace

Salary will be commensurate with experience. A comprehensive benefits package including paid time off is offered with this position. This position will work an average of 40 hours per week and will be available “after hours” if an emergency situation should arise.

Trulieve provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Job Title: Extraction Lead

Department: Processing

FLSA Status: Regular- Non-Exempt

Location: Adel, GA

Role Summary:
Trulieve is looking for an Extraction Lead to support our extraction and production operations.? You should be very technically astute in mechanical, electrical, and computer operated systems utilized in production/manufacturing environments. You need to be proactive, quick thinking and innovative in your approach.

Key Duties and Responsibilities:
Ensure that team members are properly communicated the goals of the shift, week, and month
Training new team members on extraction equipment and procedures.
Ensuring policy and procedure compliance across all processes within the department.
Monitoring employee attendance and performance.
Oversee equipment cleaning and maintenance policies, ensuring equipment is well maintained.
Maintaining strict inventory records of all plant materials, chemicals, and equipment used in the facility, assisting in improving records when needed
Oversee process flow throughout department, making changes in allocation of resources to meet demand
Operating, maintaining, and making adjustments and repairs to extraction equipment
Ensuring team members store supplies and equipment and disposal of waste according to guidelines
Maintaining inventory records of supplies, materials, and equipment and preparing requisitions as needed
Maintaining material safety data sheets for all chemicals and products
Following all standard operating procedures regarding product creation and lab safety
Works with testing laboratory as defined by state guidelines
Other duties as assigned

Understanding of state and local laws
Understanding of proper and safe handling of hazardous materials
Familiarity with separations, isolations and fractionation
Knowledge of solvent and solvent free extraction methods
Stay current of practices and new developments in the cannabis extraction industry
Ability to work quickly without compromising accuracy
Ability to discern the quality of plant material and finished products
Strong computer and social skills
Cannabis knowledge including specifically Ethyl extraction
Strong leadership skills
Strong communication skills
Manufacturing experience preferred

ADDITIONAL MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Must be a minimum of 21 years of age
Must successfully complete a comprehensive background screening

Must be able to work seated/standing as appropriate at workstations for extended periods of time, maintain body equilibrium while climbing ladders, stairways, stopping, kneeling, crouching, and reaching, and use hands/fingers to hold, grasp, turn, pick, pinch frequently/constantly to complete tasks

Must have visual acuity with/without job aids to perform activities such as; reading, viewing a computer terminal, visual inspection involving small parts/details. Clarity of vision at 20 ft or more in day and night/dark conditions
Must be able to speak and communicate verbally at conversation levels with co-workers, vendors, etc. (Moderate noise)

40+ hours weekly with flexible hours depending on department needs. Must be available to work occasional evenings, weekends, and holidays

ABOUT YOU

Are you passionate and ready to join an inclusive work environment, committed to leading new ideas and pathways, and to delivering value? If the answer is, “Yes!” then we have an exciting career opportunity for you. Who are we? We are Montrose, a leading environmental services company with 2,500 employees across 70+ locations worldwide, focused on supporting clients as they deal with the environmental challenges of today, and prepare for what’s coming tomorrow.

WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU

Our Mission is: To help protect the air we breathe, the water we drink, and the soil that feeds us, and is supported by our Principles: We Value Our People, We Value Our Community, We Value Our Clients, We Value Our Shareholders. We care for the well-being of our people and offer:

Competitive compensation packages
Industry leading benefits packages including company paid life and disability insurance
Paid parental leave benefits
Progressive vacation policies and company holidays including floating holidays to meet the diverse needs of our people.
401(k) plan offered
A financial assistance program to help support peers in need
An educational reimbursement program
Access to best rates in the industry to bring your student loan debt down to size

A DAY IN THE LIFE

Enthalpy Analytical, is part of the larger organization, Montrose Environmental Group, is comprised of over 9 laboratories servicing air, water, soil, tobacco, cannabis, and toxicity testing. Regulations drive the need for our services, but our unique capabilities allow us to add value to clients beyond environmental compliance.

Our Orange, CA facility is currently seeking a Full-Time Laboratory Technician to join our team.

As a key member of the laboratory team, this role will be responsible for a full range of activities including:

Preparation of samples for analysis
Preparation of reagents for lab use and/or shipment
Sample extractions
Determining the volume of samples
Cleaning of laboratory glassware
Maintaining clean laboratory areas
Maintaining organized records of sample preparation and analysis
Courier supplies to and/or samples from client sites
Overhead projects designed to improve efficiency of, or accuracy of analyses
Assisting the Group Leaders and analysts in acquiring and inventorying consumables, chemicals, and parts for instrumentation
Dispose of laboratory waste in a safe manner following prescribed procedures
Comply with Enthalpy’s Quality Assurance Program and other policies
Comply with Enthalpy’s Health and Safety Plan
Other duties as assigned by the Group Leader or Lab Director

NECESSARY QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, individuals must be able to perform each duty and responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the duties and responsibilities.

High School diploma or equivalent required

PREFERRED SKILLS

Prior Laboratory experience preferred but not required as this is an entry level position
Knowledge of analytical method, analytical instruments, general lab practices and lab safety
Ability to work independently and in a team
Good organizational skills and strong communication skills

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees so classified.

MAKE THE MOVE

From comprehensive air measurement and laboratory services to regulatory compliance, emergency response, permitting, engineering, and remediation, Montrose delivers innovative and practical design, engineering and operational solutions that keep its clients on top of their immediate needs – and well ahead of the strategic curve. We are a fast-paced and dynamic team. At Montrose, you are your own boss, but you will get tons of guidance and plenty of support from talented, super-smart colleagues. Therefore, if freedom, autonomy, head-scratching professional challenges attract you, we’d love to speak with you.

Want to know more about us? Visit montrose-env.com and have fun!

Montrose is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Montrose is committed to providing access and reasonable accommodation in its employment for individuals with disabilities.

Requisition ID: 1081

Remote Work Available: No

Position Summary

The Extraction Manager is responsible for leading and navigating day-to-day oil extraction laboratory operations. This includes working with extraction equipment to assist with the extraction process, cleaning equipment, and conducting general extraction lab duties, to ensure products consistently meet specifications. In addition, ensure processes and procedures are optimized, equipment is maintained regularly, and workflow meets the necessary specifications. Our goal is to optimize lab procedures and succeed in producing consistent, safe, and quality products. Communication skills, organization, attention to safety, detail, and time management are critical to the success of our lab.

Core Duties

Under direction of the Plant Manager and Assistant Plant Processing Manager, the Extraction Manager duties shall include, but not be limited to, the following:

Provide supervision and leadership to the Extraction Lab, regarding production schedules, associated testing, continuously improving quality, reducing waste, and increasing throughput.
Leading the operation and maintenance of extraction equipment.
Help develop and execute Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
Oversee the front-end processing of raw materials, including weighing, grinding, cleaning and general lab work.
Ensure preparation of the workspace, equipment, and materials daily.
Oversee washing and sterilization of laboratory glassware and equipment.
Schedule and perform regular maintenance, cleaning, and repairs of all equipment.
Direct administrative tasks, such as documenting all machine maintenance, logging test results, printing labels, and auditing products and supplies with Supervisors.
Ensure accurate weighing and recording all product weights.
Oversee samples to be sent to lab.
Responsible for inventory, recordkeeping, quality of product, and maintaining inventory via the ERP System.
Develop, discipline, and coach Supervisors, Leads, and team members.

Essential Work Experience and Qualifications:
Strong knowledge of chemical extraction and distillation/refining theory.
Experience with extraction, preparation, and purification of cannabinoids via, Ethanol, CO2, and Hydrocarbon extraction methods.
Supervisory experience, preferably in chemical process operations.
Experience with detailed record keeping, proper labeling, and data tracking.
Solid computer skills, including Microsoft and Google Suites (Docs, Sheets, Calendar).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
In-depth understanding of compliance laws for the Florida cannabis industry.
Motivated and self-driven.
Deep technical knowledge and proven experience in extraction methods and techniques, and a passion for cannabis extracts.
Ability to work with minimal direction and solid problem-solving skills.
Embrace change and new ideas.
Strict adherence to policies and procedures.
Must be at least 21 years of age.

Minimum Education and Experience

3 to 4 years’ experience in manufacturing operations.
2 to 3 years’ experience in a supervisory capacity.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required.
Working knowledge of OSHA and EPA regulations.
GMP manufacturing experience.
Ability to coach and mentor employees on a one-on-one basis as well as in a group.

Additional Requirements

Florida Driver's License or ability to obtain one.
Must be a minimum of 21 years of age.
Must be and remain compliant with all legal or company regulations for working in the cannabis industry.
Ability to pass a Level 2 Background check.

Working Conditions

Must be able to push, pull, move, and/or lift a minimum of 50 lbs. to a minimum height of 5 feet and able to push, pull, move, and/or carry such weight a minimum distance of 50 feet, with or without mechanical assistance.
Must be able to work seated/standing as appropriate at workstations for extended periods of time, maintain body equilibrium while climbing ladders, stairways, stopping, kneeling, crouching, and reaching, and use hands/fingers to hold, grasp, turn, pick, pinch frequently/constantly to complete tasks.
Must be able to handle organic matter daily, able to wear PPE as appropriate (eye, face, hand, arm, head, foot, body, fall protection).
Must have visual acuity with/without job aids to perform activities such as reading, viewing a computer terminal, visual inspection involving small parts/details.
Must be able to speak and communicate verbally at conversation levels with co-workers, vendors, etc., in moderate noise.

Salary will be commensurate with experience. A comprehensive benefits package including paid time off is offered with this position. This position will work an average of 50 hours per week and will be available “after hours” if an emergency should arise. We are an EOE company

Salary will be commensurate with experience. A comprehensive benefits package including paid time off is offered with this position. This position will work an average of 40 hours per week and will be available “after hours” if an emergency situation should arise.

Trulieve provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Requisition ID: 1183

Remote Work Available: No

Description & Requirements

Description

Job Title: Safety Tech

Department: Cultivation HS&E

Reports to: Cultivation Safety Manager

FLSA Status: Regular- Non-Exempt

Role Summary:
Safety Tech - to assist in the overall supervision and administration of project safety to maintain a safe and healthy work environment. The successful individual will coordinate safety efforts with each business unit and communicate details of safety conditions/behaviors with all levels of management. Responsible for developing, enhancing, inspecting and evaluating the workplace environment, equipment and processes in manufacturing, cultivation, warehouse, grounds, laboratory and office working areas to ensure compliance with safety regulations and industry standards. Maintain applicable records and documentation demonstrable during an inspection or audit. Champions a culture of preparedness and safety.

Key Duties and Responsibilities:
Champion all safety programs and initiatives

Grow the safety culture by training, personal interaction, and developing relationships with all hourly and salaried team members

Participate in developing and conducting compliance training

Manage Worker Compensation claims

Daily inspection of machinery, equipment, and working conditions to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and safe work practices

Conduct hazard assessments to determine appropriate personal protection equipment. Observe employees to determine appropriate use of prescribed equipment

Inspection of specified areas for fire-prevention equipment, first-aid supplies, and other safety devices

Test working areas for hazard exposures (noise, toxic, etc.) using associated testing equipment

Prepare report of findings with recommendations for corrective action

Investigation of accidents per program procedures to establish root cause for use in recommending preventive safety measures

Build cross-functional safety teams to drive a world class safety culture

Maintain chemical inventory, SDS and waste inspections per EPA guidelines

Documenting all accidents, safety violations, unsafe conditions, or behavior

Implement and manage a behavioral based safety program to reduce incidents and drive engagement

Assisting in development of standardized job safety analysis (JSA) as well as project specific safety plans

Conduct safety meetings with associates to instruct them on project safety practices and requirements

Demonstrate use of equipment and develop safety related standard operating procedures

Other duties as assigned

SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:
2 or more years of experience or education in a safety related position. (Preferred)

Demonstrates competency in understanding and correcting data discrepancies; data querying; identifying root cause analysis; understanding and identifying data trends

Possess computer proficiency, speed and knowledge of Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)

Working knowledge of OSHA / EPA regulations and practices.

Basic knowledge of manufacturing / transportation safety a plus

OSHA 10- and 30-hour certifications (Preferred)

Must acquire OSHA 501 Certification within a specified time period

Must possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills

Ability to work a flexible schedule

Must be able to support multiple site locations as necessary

Ability to multi-task and work in a methodical and organized way

Highly Motivated, Attention to detail

Strong Communication Skills

Self-motivated attitude with excellent work ethic

Bi-Lingual is a plus

ADDITIONAL MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
High School Diploma / 2- or 4-year Degree (Preferred)

Must possess a valid driver’s license and good driving record

Must be a minimum of 21 years of age

Must successfully complete a comprehensive background screening

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
Must be able to push, pull, move, and/or lift a minimum of 50 lbs. to a minimum height of 5 feet and able to push, pull, move, and/or carry such weight a minimum distance of 50 feet, with or without mechanical assistance

Must be able to work seated/standing as appropriate at workstations for extended periods of time, maintain body equilibrium while climbing ladders, stairways, stopping, kneeling, crouching, and reaching, and use hands/fingers to hold, grasp, turn, pick, pinch frequently/constantly to complete tasks

Must be able to handle organic matter daily, able to wear PPE as appropriate (eye, face, hand, arm, head, foot, body, fall protection), and able to be exposed to hot, cold, wet, humid, or windy conditions while wearing PPE (95 degrees or greater)

Must have visual acuity with/without job aids to perform activities such as reading, viewing a computer terminal, visual inspection involving small parts/details. Clarity of vision at 20 ft or more in day and night/dark conditions

Must be able to speak and communicate verbally at conversation levels with co-workers, vendors, etc. (Moderate noise)

WORK SCHEDULE:
40+ hours weekly with flexible hours depending on department needs. Must be available to work occasional evenings, weekends, and holidays

Equal Opportunity Employer l Trulieve Supports a Drug Free Workplace

Salary will be commensurate with experience. A comprehensive benefits package including paid time off is offered with this position. This position will work an average of 40 hours per week and will be available “after hours” if an emergency situation should arise.

Trulieve provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

ABOUT YOU

Are you passionate about the environment and ready to join an inclusive work environment, committed to excellence, to new ideas, and to delivering value? If the answer is, “Yes!” then we have an exciting career opportunity for you based in our Durham, NC lab. Who are we? We are Montrose, the premier environmental services provider.

The Laboratory Technician I will be responsible for various laboratory functions. You’ll need some basic knowledge of a lab environment and welcome the opportunity to make an impact from day one.

WHAT WE CAN OFFER TO YOU

Our Mission is: To help protect the air we breathe, the water we drink, and the soil that feeds us, and is supported by our Principles: We Value Our People, We Value Our Community, We Value Our Clients, We Value Our Shareholders. We care for the well-being of our people and offer:

Competitive compensation packages
Competitive medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage
Medical, Dependent Care and Transit Flexible Spending Accounts
Company paid Life and Disability Insurance and access to additional voluntary programs
401k with a competitive employer match
Progressive vacation policies and company holiday to ensure work/life balance for our people.
A financial assistance program to help support peers in need.
Access to telemedicine and employee assistance programs
Access to best rates in the industry to bring your student loan debt down to size

A DAY IN THE LIFE

Enthalpy Analytical, is part of the larger organization, Montrose Environmental Group, is comprised of 10 laboratories servicing air, water, soil, tobacco, cannabis, and toxicology testing. Regulations drive the need for our services, but our unique capabilities allow us to add value to clients beyond environmental compliance.

As a key member of the Durham team, this role will be responsible for a full range of activities including:

Preparation of samples for analysis
Preparation of reagents for lab use and/or shipment
Sample extractions
Spectrophotometric analyses
Determining the volume of samples
Cleaning of laboratory glassware
Maintaining clean laboratory areas
Maintaining organized records of sample preparation and analysis
Overhead projects designed to improve efficiency of, or accuracy of analyses
Assisting the Group Leaders and analysts in acquiring and inventorying consumables, chemicals, and parts for instrumentation
Comply with Enthalpy’s Quality Assurance Program and other policies
Comply with Enthalpy’s Health and Safety Plan
Other duties as assigned by the Group Leader or Lab Director

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, individuals must be able to perform each duty and responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the duties and responsibilities.

Bachelor's degree in Chemistry, Biology, Environmental Science, or related field preferred
2 years of relevant lab experience allows direct advancement to Tech II (academic lab counts)

PREFFERED SKILLS

Prior Laboratory experience preferred but not required as this is an entry level position
Knowledge of analytical method, analytical instruments, general lab practices and lab safety
Ability to work independently and in a team
Good organizational skills and strong communication skills

Receive environmental samples into the laboratory

We are looking for a full-time Microbiology Laboratory Technician to prepare samples for Total Yeast and Mold (TYAM) and qPCR analysis for Salmonella, STEC, and Aspergillus, perform water activity analysis, and assist with other general laboratory tasks and projects.


This position requires being in the lab Tuesdays through Saturdays from 10am - 6:30pm. The person that fills this position may choose to adjust their start time on Saturdays. The schedule for this position is unlikely to change, so the candidate must be comfortable with this schedule.


This is an entry level position with opportunity for growth. Must be able to interact professionally with colleagues.
Must have good documentation and communication skills.
Must have strong attention to detail and is accuracy-oriented.
Must be able to adhere to strict deadlines.

Has some experience working in a laboratory.
Is comfortable performing repetitive tasks.
Thrives in a fast-paced environment and adapts well to change.
Has experience handling large sample loads.

Company Description


Since our founding in 2009, Rm3 Labs has been a leader in providing scientific analysis for the cannabis community of Colorado. As a fully independent, analytical laboratory located in Broomfield, we bring state-of-the-art scientific expertise and technology to help our clients produce safe, pure, and effective cannabis products. We are ISO/IEC 17025 accredited and licensed and certified by the State.


Job Summary


We are looking for a full-time Courier and Accessioning Technician to plan routes, pick up samples from client facilities in the Denver metro area, Fort Collins/Boulder, and/or Colorado Springs/Pueblo, accession samples in-house, and provide excellent customer service.


This position will require driving in a personal vehicle (58 cents per mile mileage reimbursement paid when using personal vehicle) or the company car, if available. It is estimated that a personal vehicle will need to be used for 150 - 200 miles per week. After courier routes, the rest of the workday will be spent in the lab accessioning samples into our system.


The schedule for this position is Mondays through Fridays from 8:30am - 5pm, unless assigned the south route, in which case the scheduled hours will be from 5:30am - 2pm.


Benefits include three weeks of paid time off, six paid holidays, maternity/paternity leave, subsidized healthcare and dental insurance, holiday bonus based on performance, and professional development assistance.


Responsibilities


Comply with State, Local, OSHA, and ISO 17025 requirements.
Follow company Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
Maintain Rm3 Labs’ brand essence when communicating with clients and lab visitors by demonstrating professional, courteous, and cooperative behavior.
Maintain general knowledge on Rm3 Labs’ services, Metrc, and current testing and sampling rules.
Operate the front desk reception area and greet and check-in visitors.
Receive samples from client facilities or from clients in the lobby and accession samples into our system.
Check samples for accuracy, tampering and/or possible adulteration and ensure all pertinent information is documented.
Label samples with the internal Rm3 Labs ID and test analyses required and deliver samples to the appropriate department inbox.
Answer phones and contact clients to correct issues with samples or manifests.
Schedule sample pick-ups and provide courier information to clients.
Plan and follow the most efficient routes for picking up samples and drive safely to client facilities to pick up samples.
Assist with training new or junior staff; may act an as onboarding buddy to new staff.
Perform other tasks, as assigned by the Accessioning Lead or Client Services Lead.
Report concerns to the Accessioning Lead or Client Service Lead.

Requirements


Must pass an extensive background check with no felony convictions and obtain a Colorado Department of Revenue – Marijuana Enforcement Division (DOR-MED) employee license prior to or at the time of hire.
Excellent driving record and a reliable vehicle.
Experience in customer service, data entry, and/or similar high-volume, detailed work.
Able to work independently and part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
Able to interact professionally with colleagues and bring up concerns immediately when you are faced with them.
Good written and verbal communication skills.
Detail and accuracy oriented.

The Ideal Candidate


Enjoys driving.
Thrives in a fast-paced, professional, and fun work environment.
Is self-motivated and focused on continual improvement.
Has a passion for the cannabis industry.
Cannabis industry experience and/or METRC experience is a strong plus.
Having a current MED employee badge is a strong plus.
Computer skills and experience in Windows and Microsoft Office is a plus.

Company Description


Since our founding in 2009, Rm3 Labs has been a leader in providing scientific analysis for the cannabis community of Colorado. As a fully independent, analytical laboratory located in Broomfield, we bring state-of-the-art scientific expertise and technology to help our clients produce safe, pure, and effective cannabis products. We are ISO/IEC 17025 accredited and licensed and certified by the State.


Job Summary


We are looking for a full-time Chemistry Analyst in our LC-MS department to perform chemical tests, analyze and record test results. This position involves preparing and analyzing cannabis flower, concentrates, and infused products for pesticide and mycotoxin contamination.


This position requires being in the lab Mondays through Fridays from 10am – 6:30pm. During training (approximately first 1-2 months), the schedule will be Mondays through Fridays from 9am - 5:30pm.


The hourly rate is based on the number of years of full-time laboratory testing experience (minimum required is 1 year of full time laboratory testing experience). Benefits include three weeks of paid time off, paid holidays, maternity/paternity leave, subsidized healthcare and dental insurance, holiday bonus based on performance, and professional development assistance.


NOTE: The State of Colorado requires analysts to have a four-year degree in chemistry, biochemistry or related field and one year of full-time experience in a testing laboratory. Candidates will need a Marijuana Enforcement Division (MED) employee license. Only current Colorado residents that have a four-year degree in a natural science and one year of full-time experience in a testing laboratory will be considered.


Responsibilities


Comply with State, Local, OSHA, and ISO 17025 requirements.
Follow company and laboratory Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
Verify lab equipment before use to ensure they are within acceptable limits.
Prepare lab reagents and working standards and verify them before use.
Prepare and test analytical samples using traditional laboratory technologies such as HPLC, GC-MS, LC-MS/MS, and ICP-MS.
Accurately record and interpret data in an organized, legible, and consistent manner on documents and in the Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS).
Review and authorize data for test reports to be created and sent to clients within prescribed reporting deadlines.
Identify, investigate, and document departures from the quality system and/or test procedures.
Troubleshoot, clean, and maintain laboratory equipment and supplies.
Perform general laboratory tasks such as inventory and consumables ordering, sample archival and disposal, cleaning, and similar lab duties.
Assist with training new or junior staff; may act an as onboarding buddy to new staff.
Assist in the development, modification, verification, and validation of methods.
Perform special projects, as assigned by the Lead Chemist, Chemistry Lab Manager, and/or Laboratory Director.
Report concerns to the Lead Chemist.

Requirements


BS/BA in chemistry, biochemistry, or related field and at least one year of full-time laboratory testing experience is required by State regulation, no exceptions.
Must pass an extensive background check with no felony convictions and obtain a Colorado Department of Revenue – MED employee license prior to or at the time of hire.
Able to work independently and part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
Able to interact professionally with colleagues and bring up concerns immediately when you are faced with them.
Great written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent laboratory troubleshooting skills.
Detail and accuracy oriented.
Computer skills and experience in Windows and Microsoft Office, particularly Excel.

The Ideal Candidate


Thrives in a fast-paced, professional, and fun work environment.
Is self-motivated, curious, and focused on continual improvement.
Has a passion for cannabis or the cannabis industry.
LC-MS experience and/or sample preparation experience for pesticides or mycotoxins testing is a strong plus.
Experience with other instruments such as HPLC, GC-MS, and/or ICP-MS is a strong plus.
Experience in high-throughput, ISO/IEC 17025 accredited, and or FDA/EPA/USDA labs is a strong plus.
